abstract: David R. Nissen, who runs GE Money, remembers how the corporate powers at General Electric used to react whenever the subject of joint ventures came up. “The basic philosophy was, ‘If you don’t have full control, don’t do the deal,'” Mr. Nissen recalled, in an interview with The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: David R. Nissen, who runs GE Money, remembers how the corporate powers at General Electric used to react whenever the subject of joint ventures came up. “The basic philosophy was, ‘If you don’t have full control, don’t do the deal,'” Mr. Nissen recalled, in an interview with The New York Times.
